Jiwon Kim

+82 (10) 6600-2755 dusxodud98@snu.ac.kr

I am an HCI Enthusiast with a strong background in Game Development, Data Mining, UX/UI, and Team Leadership. Currently, I'm an Undergraduate Research Intern at HCI Lab, Seoul National University. I have managed live game services for 3 years, serving up to 100,000 concurrent online users. My interests include Data Mining, Human-AI interaction, and Effective Information Visualization.

Present

Full Stack Game Developer

AWESOMEPIECE, Seoul, Korea

Managed live services for 3 years, with a maximum of 100K concurrent online users. Utilized Java(Netty), C#(Unity), Python(Django), MySQL, and Google Cloud Platform. Developed an interest in UX(User Experience), UI(User Interface), and related fields.

September 2019 - February 2023

CUDA Engineer Intern

MindsLab, Pangyo, South Korea

Focused on Text-To-Speech (TTS) Throughput Optimization using Python, CUDA, and Docker. Achieved a 10x to 100x speed increase in TTS (Tacotron 2) using CUDA MPS. Developed a Python-based profiler to assess model performance.

July 2019 - August 2019

Projects

Zombie High School (At AWESOMEPIECE)

A 2D action game with over 10 million downloads. Developed a multiplayer 2D pixel game using Unity and Java Netty on a concurrent server. Implemented various game content such as bosses and new modes. Enhanced user experience by introducing reconnect functionality. Collaborated with artists and game designers to create an engaging user experience.

King God Castle (At AWESOMEPIECE)

An Auto Chess game with over a million downloads. Developed a 2D pixel game using Unity and Java Spring Boot web server. Gained experience in global game service, reaching over 20 countries. Served as Development Team Leader – managed team schedule and trained approximately 5 junior developers.

Non-linear Image Processing Module with LG Innotek

Engineered a PCB board defect detection module using Python, OpenCV, and multiprocessing. Received recognition for algorithm optimization that surpassed field efficiency.

BridgeUS

Contributed to a K-pop clothing e-commerce platform using TypeScript (Frontend), Python (Backend), React-Redux, Django, MySQL, and Amazon Web Services. Primarily acted as a backend developer, implementing a machine learning-based recommendation algorithm. View the project on GitHub.
